comments.commentBody:
For 41D I consulted my spouse, who actually subscribed to Nancy comics when she was a kid. How do you spell Sluggo, I asked, and was he a bully? She confirmed the two-G spelling, and that the kid was tough-looking but really a sweetheart. Best of all, she came up with BLUTO. The woman is a genius.

Wonderful puzzle, classic PB.

I redid the model detailed in #90 and #92 with the mass of the large ball taken as 2.06.

As expected, there are only minor changes in the velocities. Here they are:
Ball 5: 1.4055
Composite Balls 1-4: 0.1312

In this model (detailed in my posts #90 and #92), I assumed that all the balls come together forming one single temporary object as a result of a shock wave that ejects the last ball. The remaining composite object of balls 1-4 then comes apart into its constituent balls simultaneously, each ball sharing the velocity equally. However, that is a very unrealistic assumption. It's much more likely, as Gary pointed out in #100, that the separation occurs in the middle. Imagine the 4 balls connected by 3 springs with some residual tension still left. It's likely that the middle spring that releases first as it has only one spring on each side to push against, while the others have two.

If we assume this to be true, and calculate how the velocity of the four-ball composite (0.1312) will be divided between the two halves, conserving momentum and kinetic energy, here is what we get:

Balls 1 and 2: velocity = 0.1205
Balls 3 and 4: velocity = 0.1476

Here's a verification that the numbers are correct and that momentum and kinetic energy are preserved for the split:

Original composite momentum (Ball 1-Ball 4 at 0.1312) = mv = 5*0.1312 = 0.66
Final momentum (Balls 1 and 2 at 0.1205: Balls 3 & 4 at 0.1476) = 3*0.1205 + 2*0.1476 = 0.66

Original kinetic energy = 0.5mv^2 = 0.5*5*(0.1312)^2 = 0.043
Final kinetic energy = 0.5*3*(0.1205)^2 + 0.5*2*(0.1476)^2 = 0.043

So the final theoretical velocities for our model of the Newton's Cradle - impact causing single object that ejects the last ball and then splits down the center are as follows (adjusted velocities for first ball of mass 2.06 as determined from Bill Gottesman's video measurements in #101, are in parentheses):

Ball 1: 0.12 (0.12)
Ball 2: 0.12 (0.12)
Ball 3: 0.15 (0.15)
Ball 4: 0.15 (0.16)
Ball 5: 1.41 (1.34 possibly underestimated due to slightly off-center hit)

This extremely simple model fits the measurements exceedingly well, without ad hoc assumptions. The velocities are uniquely determined by the three natural assumptions of the model - that all the balls come together, ball 5 is ejected and then the composite of balls 1-4 splits down the center.

It works pretty well, and seems to be substantially correct. The test would be to see whether different ball sizes and configurations give equally good predictions.

So to answer the original question, the answer is A - only one ball flies off. The pairwise collision model does not work.

And what difference would it have made if we had Wikileaks in 1973 ?

Would knowledge of this grave ethical lapse of conscience caused the public to rise up and change anything ?

Are we doing anything now even about something as basic as passing a budget ?

Our representative democracy is failing becxause with or without the truth, we may not think like Kissinger but as a socirty we act like it. We just think we can keep our head buried in the sand and say when asked " its not my fault. "

We better wake up anmd put our wallets on the line or we will simply become a nation of mercenaries, bought and paid for by China and countries that supply the source of energy.

Lets switch the topic to present reality rather than past ignorance.

You would think Kissinger would have sold anything for his own sake.  His total lack of concern for his own people is despicable.  Nixon and Kissinger made quite a pair-they brought much misery, and we are just fortunate that the world has survived them.
". . . no hatred more deadly than hatred of one's own class."  Eugene Debs

All this says to me is that even though I grew up in those times, I will never quite understand what drove the international politics of the time.  I understand that we were, every day, at the brink, but still nothing seems to fit together.  The fact that all these revelations are so blood-boiling gives me pause.  Quite literally, what were we thinking, and why?

I find it humorous that Nixon supporters in the comments section are offended by critiques of the late President, as if some leftwing conspiracy brought down Nixon. The man nearly destroyed the Office of the President. Almost brought a nation to its knees. He resigned under duress, about to be impeached. His actions were criminal.

Mr. Haberman, the author of this article, appears willfully ignorant of Kissinger and Nixon's realist foreign policy. Remember Détente and Triangulation? Or that "only Nixon could go to China?" Mr. Kissinger's policies were so effective precisely because he understood the environment in which the U.S. operated.
Mr. Haberman mentions Kissinger's "realpolitik," but shows no appreciation for what the concept means, or how valuable realism was to American foreign policy during the Cold War.
Like a non-lawyer explaining the holding of a Supreme Court case, Mr. Haberman misses the subtlety and context of Kissinger's remarks; instead he goes straight for the low blow, eagerly disregarding the truth in favor of a sucker punch.

In terms of political ability, Kissenger is near-genius.  He is also the kind of person who would not hesitate to collect the fillings from the teeth of a corpse.  These two characteristics are not merely coincidental.
I think only Americans think this criminal is fine and dandy. Ship Henry out of the country and watch what happens to him.

Persons without conscience (AKA sociopaths) know neither ethnicity nor religion. Much of the policy of the world's governments and corporations is made by such persons. They know they will bear few if any consequences for their acts.

This is a wonderfully revealing article which made me carefully consider the issue. While no fan of HAK or RMN, I still think a President needs the most objective, impartial advice he can muster but he usually ends up surrounding himself with sycophants like HAK. Russia is a nuclear power and a threat, and all other considerations, including moral ones, can pale in comparison. Might makes right. However, the public also deserves the benefit of that objective advice (thank you NY TImes and Wikileaks). If our information weren't so tainted by egos and politics, everyone would look at the world more clearly; maybe the Internet will give us that insight and clarity at last. HAK's legacy is really more as a Secretary of War than a Secretary of State.
Why am I not surprised that one the the world's worst living war criminals wouldn't care at all about genocide?

Always delighted to find new evidence of Kissinger's sociopathology.  Less so to read some of the first 28 comments, with their antisemitism, historical ignorance, nonsequiturs.  Most awesome is the anachronism which identifies HK as the model for Dr. Strangelove.  That honor belongs to, among others, Werner von Braun, Edward Teller, Leo Strauss.  Kissinger's apotheosis did not begin until years after the film appeared.
I'm glad Henry Kissinger and Billy Graham lived long enough to see their behavior exposed.  Usually - the bad stuff waits until leaders are long and gone.

In a sense, Kissinger did the Jewish People a favor.  At a time when memories have faded among younger generations of Jews, he served a cold reminder of why the Jewish state had to be reestablished after 2000 years of exile -- because ultimately the Jewish People can only rely on themselves when faced with the most existential danger.  Without power -- especially military power -- the world (including a cold-blooded court Jew like Kissinger) would treat the Jews with the same expediency as it did in WWII, as it did the Tutsi in Rwanda, and as it is doing now in Darfur.  There'd be sorrow; there'd be outrage; there'd be brave speeches, some fundraisers; maybe even a spineless UN presence; but the proverbial "cooler heads" would prevail in the face of supposed larger concerns such as war vs. pragmatism -- at least that's what they'd tell themselves.  The world and humanity won't change anytime soon; but at least it knows this time there's a Jewish state highly armed and ready if there is a next time.

I'm sorry, "Henry Kissinger widely admired"... by who? Aspiring war criminals?

This man was responsible for countless atrocities and deaths, and we're supposed to be surprised that he was just as callous about his fellow Jews as any other group deserving of human rights that got in the way of his megalomania? Sociopaths are incapable of empathy for anyone- only power and pleasure- as gained through power's aphrodesiac effects that the man himself acknowledges.

Well, this isn't too surprising from Mr.Vietnam himself.
So Many Americans died there...& it wasn't his concern!

war criminal and peace prize winner!

scum of the earth.
Time for a change:  Who wrote the report to which you referred?  Can you prove it exists? Contrary to your fiction: Jews are well known for helping each other when times get tough.

Dear #10 Jack from Scottsdale, gas chambers and genocide are not Jewish issues.  These are global questions of humanity.  Rwandan genocide had little to do with American immediate interests, but it didn't make anyone proud to just watch it happen. The comments about gas chambers were bizarre coming from someone who narrowly himself escaped that fate by luck of immigration -- a chance that most of his compatriots didn't have because of people like Jack.

Genocide is “not an American concern,” he said, but “maybe a humanitarian concern.”
Is this statement “false”? Are we G-d or the USA? Are you implying that we have greater values than the rest of the world and are therefore beholden to save it from itself for all its cruelties and acts of inhumanity? What hubris! Even if we could, we didn’t. We knew very well what was going on in Nazi Germany for years and did nothing about it until attacked by Japan and were thus “forced” into the war. I don’t understand why people feel this country is the “Great Protector” of Jews, Cambodians, Sudanese, Armenians, etc.. All of these tragedies and many more we have stood witness to as a Nation. We have never been proactive on that front and it may in fact best be addressed from a multi-lateral position. (Well, ok, we act unilaterally when you have oil but that’s another article all together)

Those of us who lived through Nixon, Kissinger, haldeman, ehrlichmam et al are all too familiar with the shameful, embarrassing disgusting behavior that 'led' our country in the late 60's and early 70's. The tapes only corroborate what we all knew then... Is it any wonder those same crappy emotions were rekindled by Cheney and Rumsfeld, who then just learning how to be Nixonian clones, when baby bush brought them back into the power circle.

We learned back then, as college students, draftees etc.that the people running our govt (particularly the republicans) cared only for themselves and their phony- baloney jobs...

i always considered kissinger an anti-semite. and a jewish anti-semite - they're the worst. considering his boss (nixon) was one of the best friends israel ever had, i'm surprised he didn't get his ass fired for that remark

So it is o.k. for Kissenger to be complicit in killing a few million Vietnamese but let him make comments about Jews, and the he is pounced on by a few Jews; the man should be in prison for crimes against humanity, and Jews can only bring themselves to be a little critical, and some, the report says, keep quite. So much for the humanity of Jews is anyone still thinks there is any after the way they have treated the Arabs, with of course the undying help of the U.S.  To venerate Kissenger for his assistance to Israel is to further point up the fact that the worse enemy of Israel are those who defend it in the face of the daily horrors they carry out every day against the Arabs. Israel is, along with the U.S. the enemy of mankind, and the world knows it. As terrible as the Holocaust was, it cannot continue to be used to justify the barbaric treatment Israel's of other people.
